posts.post_content:
These remaining cards will be in the February 2011 B&L Auction

Scans are here:   [url]http://s285.photobucket.com/albums/ll71/craigw67217/T206%20For%20Sale/?start=all[/url]

Craig,
Just wanted to commend you for providing your honest descriptions of the card's grade as well as those you suspect may be trimmed.  Personally, I think you're grading yourself too harshly (eg some of those "fairs" look more like "goods" to me), but give you props for erring on the side of caution as the seller rather than act greedily.
--S

[quote name="shaunsteig" post=856239]Craig,
Just wanted to commend you for providing your honest descriptions of the card's grade as well as those you suspect may be trimmed.  Personally, I think you're grading yourself too harshly (eg some of those "fairs" look more like "goods" to me), but give you props for erring on the side of caution as the seller rather than act greedily.
--S[/QUOTE]

Yes, I try to be conservative about the grade of raw cards that I'm selling.

All of the raw cards I've listed were received raw and I've never submitted them to a 3rd party grader.

The ones I've listed as (Trimmed?) mean I won't guarantee they would grade numerically.  I've not measured them, but the edges and corners look to me to be a bit too sharp for a 100 year old card.

Thanks and Best Regards,
Craig
